title: Phase 1: Foundation
description: Set up monorepo, define core types (GremlinSpec, session format), build session optimizer.

title: Build session optimizer (delta encoding, dictionary)
description: Build the session optimization layer that converts raw events to optimized format. Implement delta time encoding, element dictionary, compression.
acceptance_criteria:
- Raw session → optimized session conversion
- Delta time encoding working
- Element dictionary deduplication working
- Gzip compression applied
- Size benchmarks documented

title: Spike: AI state machine extraction
description: Test if Claude can reliably infer meaningful state machines from session data. Create 10 sample sessions (mock or real), prompt Claude to extract states/transitions, evaluate quality.
acceptance_criteria:
- 10 sample sessions created
- Claude prompt tested
- Results documented: Can it infer meaningful states vs just 'screen 1, 2, 3'?
- Go/no-go decision documented

title: Define optimized session format with protobuf
description: Define the wire format for sessions using Protocol Buffers. Include delta encoding, element dictionary, performance samples.
design:
Protobuf schema with:
- SessionHeader (device info, once per session)
- ElementDictionary (deduplicated elements)
- GremlinEvent (delta-encoded time, enum types)
- TapEvent, ScrollEvent, NavigationEvent, NetworkEvent
- PerformanceSample (fps, memory, network timing)
acceptance_criteria:
- Proto files defined in @gremlin/proto
- TypeScript types generated from proto
- Encode/decode functions work
- Size reduction validated (target: 10-50x vs naive JSON)

title: Gremlin MVP
description: AI-powered test generation from real user sessions for Web + React Native. Auto-generate E2E tests (Playwright for web, Maestro for mobile) from real user behavior.

title: Phase 5: Fuzzing & CLI Polish
description: Build fuzz generator and complete CLI: random walks, boundary abuse, sequence mutation, back button chaos. Wire up all CLI commands.
acceptance_criteria:
- gremlin fuzz generates chaos tests from GremlinSpec
- All fuzz strategies implemented
- CLI commands fully functional: init, record, generate, fuzz, run
- Progress feedback and error handling polished

title: Spike: PostHog API data format
description: Explore PostHog API to understand what session data is available, format, and export capabilities. Determine if we can programmatically access recordings.
acceptance_criteria:
- PostHog API documented
- Sample session data exported
- Data format analyzed: what events, coordinates, element info available?
- Bulk export feasibility assessed

title: Phase 2: Recording SDK
description: Build the recording infrastructure: recorder-core (transport, storage, performance), recorder-web (rrweb wrapper), recorder-react-native (custom gesture + testID capture).
acceptance_criteria:
- recorder-core with HTTP transport and local storage
- recorder-web wrapping rrweb with element enrichment
- recorder-react-native capturing gestures + testID
- Performance metrics attached to events
- Local recording works end-to-end

title: Phase 0: Validation Spikes
description: Validate core assumptions before building. Must pass before proceeding with full implementation.
acceptance_criteria: - AI state extraction spike completed with documented results\n- RN gesture capture spike completed with feasibility assessment\n- PostHog API exploration completed with data format documented

title: Define GremlinSpec types (TLA+-compatible)
description: Define the core state machine model that everything builds on. Must be TLA+-serializable. Includes State, Transition, Property, Variable types.
design:
GremlinSpec interface with:
- states: State[]
- transitions: Transition[]
- properties: Property[]
- variables: Variable[]
- initialState: StateId

Must be serializable to TLA+, Playwright, Maestro, XState.
acceptance_criteria:
- GremlinSpec type defined in @gremlin/core
- State, Transition, Property types defined
- Predicate type for guards/invariants
- toTLA() serializer stubbed
- Types are strict and well-documented

title: Spike: RN gesture + testID capture
description: Validate that we can reliably capture testID/accessibilityLabel when gestures occur in React Native. Test with both standard Pressable and RNGH components.
acceptance_criteria:
- Test app created with various gesture handlers
- Capture mechanism prototyped
- Document: which gestures can we intercept?
- Document: can we get testID reliably?
- Identify gaps where vision AI fallback needed

title: Update RN recorder docs - remove 'coming soon', document current state
Phase 4: AI Pipeline
description: Build the AI-powered analysis and generation: Claude integration, flow analyzer (sessions → GremlinSpec), test generator (GremlinSpec → Playwright/Maestro), vision interpreter.
acceptance_criteria:
- Claude API integration working
- Flow analyzer extracts GremlinSpec from sessions
- Test generator produces valid Playwright tests
- Test generator produces valid Maestro YAML
- Vision interpreter maps screenshots → elements

title: Implement gremlin run command (unified test runner)
description: The 'gremlin run' command is a stub. Implement detection of .gremlin/tests/playwright or .gremlin/tests/maestro directories and spawn respective test runners (npx playwright test / maestro test). Provides unified DX - one CLI instead of forcing users to know underlying tools.

title: Phase 6: Polish & Launch
description: Final polish: PostHog import adapter, documentation, example apps, test on real app.
acceptance_criteria:
- PostHog import works
- README and docs complete
- Example web app with Gremlin
- Example Expo app with Gremlin
- Tested on your real app

title: Initialize monorepo with Bun workspaces
description: Set up the gremlin monorepo structure with Bun workspaces. Create package scaffolds for cli, core, recorder-core, recorder-web, recorder-react-native, proto, server.
acceptance_criteria:
- Monorepo initialized with bun workspaces
- All package directories created
- TypeScript configured
- Packages can import each other
- Basic build/test scripts work
notes: Can start monorepo setup in parallel with AI spike - no dependency

title: Prove AI analysis value - run on real sessions, measure test quality
description: The AI analysis (flow-analyzer.ts) is unproven. Run it on real sessions from a production app, measure: (1) do generated tests actually pass? (2) do they catch real bugs? (3) how much manual cleanup is needed? Without this data, we can't claim the tool provides value.

title: Basic CLI scaffold
description: Create the CLI structure with commander. Stub out commands: init, record, import, generate, fuzz, run.
acceptance_criteria:
- CLI executable works: gremlin --help
- All commands stubbed with descriptions
- gremlin init creates .gremlin/ directory
- Config file structure defined

title: Phase 3: Server Infrastructure
description: Build Cloudflare-based server: Workers ingest API, R2 session storage, D1 metadata, basic auth.
acceptance_criteria:
- Cloudflare Workers deployed
- /v1/sessions endpoint accepting protobuf uploads
- R2 storing session blobs
- D1 storing metadata
- API key auth working

title: Fix README documentation drift - references non-existent @gremlin/core
description: README.md references @gremlin/core which doesn't exist. Actual packages: @gremlin/session, @gremlin/analysis, @gremlin/ast, etc. Either create the core package to unify shared types, or update docs to reflect the split architecture. This confuses contributors.

title: Implement PostHog session importer
description: The 'gremlin import --posthog' command is a stub (console.log). Implement fetching recordings from PostHog's API and converting their rrweb-compatible events into GremlinSession format. This unlocks the analytics-to-test value proposition for teams already using PostHog - they get test generation without changing their recording setup.

title: Hide gremlin verify command until prototype exists
